update.title: Add grid view to Citadel
update.reason: Grid merged forward from ign-gazebo2, scene deprecations postponed.

content.raw:
I was wondering why the PR was not showing conflicts about the `ShowGrid` function already existing, and found it up here :wink: 

@{5d3f35705e485d0dab01c896} , we can decline this PR then. Thank you for iterating!
content.html:
I was wondering why the PR was not showing conflicts about the ShowGrid function already existing, and found it up here

@Claire Wang , we can decline this PR then. Thank you for iterating!

content.raw: @{557058:6ff86fcb-b7ab-44a5-b8a6-f6d9cae8b6e8} After removing the deprecation warning and reverting the sdf files, I realize there’s nothing else to add to Citadel since the grid is already ported. Since grid is on by default, the test file is no longer needed either. I guess this PR can then be closed. Did I forget anything?
content.html: @Louise Poubel After removing the deprecation warning and reverting the sdf files, I realize there’s nothing else to add to Citadel since the grid is already ported. Since grid is on by default, the test file is no longer needed either. I guess this PR can then be closed. Did I forget anything?

content.raw: The grids have been forward-ported with pull request #471, so I think this PR is just about the deprecation now.
content.html: The grids have been forward-ported with pull request #471, so I think this PR is just about the deprecation now.

content.raw:
that sounds good to me. 

We don’t have logic to override scene’s background color from client so we should not merge the above ign-rendering2 pull request yet. 

I’ll look into this. But don’t let it block this PR since it’s about grids
content.html:
that sounds good to me.

We don’t have logic to override scene’s background color from client so we should not merge the above ign-rendering2 pull request yet.

I’ll look into this. But don’t let it block this PR since it’s about grids

content.raw:
Good point. So I guess the desired behaviour for both background and ambient would be:

* Use `<scene><background>` for both server and client
* If `<plugin><background_color>` is set for the client, override the color from `<scene>`

Does that seem reasonable? Is that already the current behaviour?
content.html:
Good point. So I guess the desired behaviour for both background and ambient would be:

  • Use <scene><background> for both server and client
  • If <plugin><background_color> is set for the client, override the color from <scene>

Does that seem reasonable? Is that already the current behaviour?

content.raw: I just realized that in subt we were taking advantage of the fact that we can set different background colors for gui and sensor, .e.g. dark background in camera sensor and bright background in gui. Maybe it’s nice to keep the background\_color param in gui?
content.html: I just realized that in subt we were taking advantage of the fact that we can set different background colors for gui and sensor, .e.g. dark background in camera sensor and bright background in gui. Maybe it’s nice to keep the background_color param in gui?

content.raw: My mistake of using <background\_color> instead of <background> in <scene>. Fixed and should be working now.
content.html: My mistake of using <background_color> instead of <background> in <scene>. Fixed and should be working now.

update.description: Add grid view to rendering, remove duplicate calls of `ambient_light` and `background_color`; Add deprecation cycle in 3D scene.
update.title: Add grid view to Citadel

content.raw: You’re right. That’s a mistake I made when copying and pasting. Thanks for catching it!
content.html: You’re right. That’s a mistake I made when copying and pasting. Thanks for catching it!

content.raw: from [sdf spec for scene](http://sdformat.org/spec?ver=1.6&elem=scene), these should be `<ambient>` and `<background>`?
content.html: from sdf spec for scene, these should be <ambient> and <background>?

content.raw: fixed in this [ign-rendering2 pull request](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/219)
content.html: fixed in this ign-rendering2 pull request

content.raw:
I moved some more elements and tweaked the warning message in 45e093c.

In my testing, I noticed that [this](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/src/9fbfc1e09bfecda975466c779314cfb1e38c8483/src/rendering/RenderUtil.cc#lines-275) `SetBackgroundColor` call is not working for `ogre2`, but works for `ogre`. Which means we're not ready to deprecate the `<background_color>` from `<plugin>` for `ogre2`. Have you seen this, @{iche033} ?
content.html:
I moved some more elements and tweaked the warning message in 45e093c.

In my testing, I noticed that this SetBackgroundColor call is not working for ogre2, but works for ogre. Which means we're not ready to deprecate the <background_color> from <plugin> for ogre2. Have you seen this, @Ian Chen ?

content.raw: Following tick-tock deprecation, I think we still want these to work on `citadel` with a warning (tick). Then we can remove them completely on `dome` (tock).
content.html: Following tick-tock deprecation, I think we still want these to work on citadel with a warning (tick). Then we can remove them completely on dome (tock).

content.raw: The grid is not required, so no need to add it. The main concern I have is about the warnings, if they're gone we're good :smile:
content.html: The grid is not required, so no need to add it. The main concern I have is about the warnings, if they're gone we're good

content.raw: Should I also add grid to all or just ambient and background color?
content.html: Should I also add grid to all or just ambient and background color?

content.raw: It's a good idea to test the deprecation, but it's probably best not to do it on an example world, because these get installed and we don't want users to get confused thinking they're doing something that needs fixing. Maybe this can be added to one of the worlds under `test/worlds`?
content.html: It's a good idea to test the deprecation, but it's probably best not to do it on an example world, because these get installed and we don't want users to get confused thinking they're doing something that needs fixing. Maybe this can be added to one of the worlds under test/worlds?

content.raw: Can we remove this from `<plugin>` and add/edit the appropriate `<scene>` to all example worlds? Ideally none of our examples should print warnings.
content.html: Can we remove this from <plugin> and add/edit the appropriate <scene> to all example worlds? Ideally none of our examples should print warnings.
